com.appriskgame.test.controller

Class PlayerTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.appriskgame.test.controller.PlayerTest

  • public class PlayerTest
extends java.lang.Object
    Test Class for Player class Method of startup ,reinforcement and fortification
    Author:
    Sahana, Shruthi, Dolly

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PlayerTest() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void initializePlayerTest()
      This is the setup method for the pre-requisite values before the test cases
      void isFortificationComplete()
      Test method to validate the number of armies present in the fromCountry and the toCountry after the player moves the armies between the adjacent fromCountry and toCountry.
      void isFortificationNotComplete()
      Test method to validate the number of armies present in the fromCountry and the toCountry after the player moves the armies between fromCountry and toCountry which are not adjacent.
      void testableToMoveArmy()
      This method is used to check if the player is able to move army if number of armies are zero or less than zero
      void testassignReinforcedArmies()
      Testing whether the count of reinforcement armies is proper
      void testassignReinforcedArmies2()
      This method is used to test the count of reinforcement armies
      void testDefaultArmiesToPlayer()
      This method to validate the allocation of armies to each player as per the number of players.
      void testIntialArmyAllocation()
      This method to validate the initial allocation of armies to each country owned by players.
      void testisCountryAdjacent()
      This method is used to check if the attacker country is adjacent to Defender country
      void testisCountryAttackNotPresent()
      This method is used to check if the player attack country is not present in the game map.
      void testisCountryAttackPresent()
      This method is used to check if the player attack country is present in the game map.
      void testisCountryNotAdjacent()
      This method is used to check if the attacker country is not adjacent to Defender country
      void testisCountryNotPresent()
      This method is used to check if the player country is present in the game map.
      void testisCountryPresent()
      This method is used to check if the player country is present in the game map.
      void testisPlayerNotWinner()
      This method is used to check if the player has not won all the countries in the map
      void testisPlayerWinner()
      This method is used to check if the player has won all the countries in the map
      void testNotableToMoveArmy()
      This method is used to check if the player is able to move army if number of armies are zero or less than zero

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
